discipline: Mechanical, Process, Civil, Structural, Electrical, Instrumentation, Controls and Procurement
description:
Our team was tasked with designing site-wide piping, equipment packages, and utilities for a greenfield water disposal terminal. This comprehensive project included truck-in packages, a tank farm, a water filtration building, pump packages, multistage high-pressure injection pumps, a flare system, and a 4 km water injection pipeline leading to a disposal well. We reviewed the feasibility of various power generation options, including natural gas, propane, and diesel. Additionally, the design included a fuel gas system and generators to provide temporary power before permanent installation. We incorporated a 1.5 MW utility transformer with a cable bus design to support multiple 400 HP water injection pumps. The project also encompassed electrical design and power studies, incorporating harmonic calculations, breaker settings, coordination curves, and arc flash assessments.
 Denali subsequently expanded the facility, adding increased water handling capabilities, incoming water and fuel gas pipelines, and additional high-pressure injection pumps, pipelines, and a disposal well.
